title: Spectate-able games box in league client
body: Riot, can you please bring back the box in the lower right corner of the league client home screen that allowed us to spectate live games of higher ranked players? I enjoyed spectating some of the players, especially when they play champions that I'm curious about. Thanks

replies.body: Does anyone know why they got rid of this?
If I had to guess, it'd be because they wanted the space for more skin ads.
I just checked and literally all of them are about the project skins. The ones that arent about in game ones are for cosplays of project skins. *sigh*

The spectating of higher ranking players wasn't entirely removed, just the feature box. 
You can go to: 
step 1  ||  Summoner profile
step 2  ||  Leagues
step 3  ||  Ranked --> Top ranked players
step 3.5||  View challenger tier (if unranked)
step 4  ||  Right click on the players with an eyeball icon, and click spectate.
step 4.5 || Top 5v5 teams ---> Top ranked players (if unranked)
step 4.6 || Follow step 4 (if unranked)

I feel if this wasn't so hidden (maybe new client will make it more of a spotlight) players could easily have the chance to improve from watching the highest level play league has to offer, not watching watching twitch. Twitch doesn't always have a huge champion pool variety, and I feel it would be beneficial to see games being played organized by champion over anything else. This way, an eager to be Syndra main, can see people higher level players play Syndra.

You can actually get it back! I can't take credit for this, but after months of being frustrated about this, I checked to see if someone had found a solution, and I found this Reddit post:
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4rhymk/what_happened_to_the_spectate_high_elo_players/

Instructions:

Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client_config_na\releases\0.0.0.58\deploy\ and find the file called "lol.properties" (This is a text file, so open it with a text editor. You will need to adjust your folder path depending on install location or version changes.)

Find this line:
lobbyLandingURL=https://frontpage.na.leagueoflegends.com/$localeCode/client/landing

Change it to:
lobbyLandingURL=

Save the file. (It's also a good idea to save a backup of the original in case you wish to revert easily.)

What the client seems to do is load a webpage onto the main client page. When you remove this URL, the client will show a different layout, and the Spectate Live section will be on the upper left of the main page.

Since this change is just preventing a page from loading  (You could also possibly just block this with your firewall instead of altering the file, but I haven't tested this.), I don't believe that this is against Riot's terms of service, and they're still providing the old spectate functionality. This doesn't change the in-game files in any way.

Again, I can't take credit for this, but let your friends know that they can spectate again if they wish!
